text:
We can see that the ﬁrst row and the last two rows cannot be used to train a supervised
model. It is also a good example to show the burden on the input variables. Speciﬁcally, that
a supervised model only has X1 to work with in order to predict both y1 and y2. Careful
thought and experimentation are needed on your problem to ﬁnd a window width that results
in acceptable model performance.
4.5 Implementing Data Preparation
